title: Can you suggest a friendship song? - Quora

response.answer_text: This was 1999. I was 9 Years old. I was on a vacation to my grandparents at Mumbai. Every single day it was a kind of ritual to have lunch and then quietly sneak out in the common balcony of our house in the chawl (different flats sharing the same balcony) system while all the elders get to snoring as loud as possible. The games start with “kitchen set”, “fake shooting”, “hide and seek”, etc. but when its just me and my friend Netra, we spent our days, dancing and singing, specially on “Keh do na, Keh do Na, You are my soniya”, One trending song during that time. This is 2018. The same song still rings in my head, i can still see the memory of us laughing till our stomach hurted. Hugging each other, Waiting for each vacation desparately to see her. It would have been the same. I wish! But Maturity took all of it from both of us. She shifted to some other place for a couple of years. I could never meet her during my summer vacations. But then there was a day when she was back in the same building. However, this time it was different. All the excitement I had vanished when i saw her. It was the feeling of rejection. She behaved in a really formal way. Hello, Hi, ok Bye. I was extremely puzzled. I couldnt understand where the innocence and the love had disappeared. My best friend may have changed, but those memories are still alive and fresh in my mind. And it has been my prized possession since then.

Bruno Mars- Count on me It's a lovely song.Hope you'll like it.   Lyrics If you ever find yourself stuck in the middle of the sea,I'll sail the world to find youIf you ever find yourself lost in the dark and you can't see,I'll be the light to guide you Find out what we're made ofWhen we are called to help our friends in need You can count on me like one two threeI'll be thereAnd I know when I need it I can count on you like four three twoYou'll be there'Cause that's what friends are supposed to do, oh yeah Whoa, whoaOh, ohYeah, yeah If you tossin' and you're turnin' and you just can't fall asleepI'll sing a songBeside youAnd if you ever forget how much you really mean to meEveryday I willRemind you OohFind out what we're made ofWhen we are called to help our friends in need You can count on me like one two threeI'll be thereAnd I know when I need it I can count on you like four three twoYou'll be there'Cause that's what friends are supposed to do, oh yeah Oh, ohYeah, yeah You'll always have my shoulder when you cryI'll never let goNever say goodbyeYou know you can Count on me like one two threeI'll be thereAnd I know when I need it I can count on you like four three twoAnd you'll be there'Cause that's what friends are supposed to do, oh yeah Oh, ohYou can count on me 'cause I can count on you

The Beatles ‘IN MY LIFE’ There are places I'll rememberAll my life, though some have changedSome forever, not for betterSome have gone and some remainAll these places have their momentsWith lovers and friends I still can recallSome are dead and some are livingIn my life, I've loved them all But of all these friends and loversThere is no one compares with youAnd these memories lose their meaningWhen I think of love as something newThough I know I'll never lose affectionFor people and things that went beforeI know I'll often stop and think about themIn my life, I love you more Though I know I'll never lose affectionFor people and things that went beforeI know I'll often stop and think about themIn my life, I love you moreIn my life-- I love you more Songwriters: John Lennon / Paul Mccartney

The song, story of us by Taylor Swift. We used to sing in class at the top of our voices during our school days. Ahh those days! Also, payphone by Maroon 5. We practiced the song for a school function but never performed it. Although, it's more of a long distance friendship now, we still are best friends. Even if we cannot sing songs together, we still record songs (she has a better voice) and send it to each other from time to time. Those were the days!

You win “one-of-the-hardest-questions-to-answer-ever” award. I have been on this planet over 50 years. Are you asking about my teen friends, my young adult friends, my middle-aged friends, or my late middle-aged” friends? Friends come and go. Not everyone who starts the great road trip of life finishes the drive with you. There has been one special friend, though. I met her when I turned 22 and she has been with me my entire adult life. She is more important than any earthly friend I’ve ever had- my wife. I think of my special friend, Patti, whom I love, when I her this song we had at our wedding…  Thanks for asking!

The song that reminds me of my best friend is a song I wrote, produced and performed - I presented it to her on valentines day! - she cries everytime she hears it!  The song is called “Yellow brick road.” Frank Baum's book written in 1900 “The wonderful wizard of OZ” Was adapted into a famous film in 1939 by MGM and became known as “The Wizard Of Oz” For me the yellow brick road was memorable for the evil ruler who ruined it before Dorothy returned for her second visit to the Emerald city. Life is my Yellow brick road. And the dark forces of life have indeed tried to ruin my Yellow brick road. But…. My wife repaired it and delivered me to the Emerald city! She guides me along my Yellow brick road beautifully and so my life is perfect. It doesn't matter what bumps appear in the road, she fixes it with her constant love and warmth and I never stop appreciating this in her. I am lucky to have found her. My life is the Emerald city thanks to her!  Please do listen now to “Yellow Brick Road” (free download for all fellow Quorans!) I hope you enjoy it! Let me know if you think I should release this? Basil Simon Musical life coach Official web site

My best friend in high school was a funny, adventurous free-spirit who I spent nearly every weekend with my freshman year. The band Chicago was very popular at the time, and the song “Saturday in the Park” had just come out. I remember singing along with it as we sat on the roof of her parents’ house in lawn chairs, and feeling happy and excited about the future. Sadly, this friend was killed in a car accident right after our ten-year reunion, but every time I hear this song I think of her and how much fun we had together in high school, riding our bikes and singing along.

From Bollywood:1. Tere Jaisa Yaar Kaha (I don't remember the movie name)2. Yeh Dosti Hum Nahi Todenge (Sholay)3. Dil Chahta Hai (title track)4. Har Ek Friend Kamina Hota Hai (Chashme Baddoor - 2013)5. Jaane Kyun (Dostana - 2008)6. Hum Rahe Ya Na Rahe Kal (sung KK and released by him on an album "Pal")7. Yaaron Aisa Hai (a song from the came and gone 2013 film "Rangrezz")One of the best ever friendship song let alone be a song in a TV ad by Airtel who released this song "Har Ek Friend Zaroori Hota Hai" around late 2011.

1-Count on me- Bruno Mars. 2-Yeh dosti hum nahi todenge (from Sholay) 3-ABCD (the song from Yaariyan movie) 4- True friends/ One in a million/If we were a movie- Miley Cyrus 5-Atrangi Yaari. 6-Jaane kyu dil…(from dostana) 7-Har Ek Friend Kamina Hota Hai (Chashme Baddoor - 2013)..and many more. And moreover, You could write a song yourself for him/her. :)

For me , the best friendship songs are1. Hum rahe yaa naa rahe kal , sung by K.K , is one my favourite song.2. Yaaroin dosty again sung by K.K.3. Tu hi toh meri dost hai from movie Yuuvraj sung by Benny Dayal and Shreya Ghoshal.4. Yaaroin from Newyork again sung by K.K5. Yeh dosti hum nahi chodenge from Sholey sung by Kishore Kumar.The above two are the best ones for me. Sorrybut I don't know the names of the movie but you can search them on Google or YouTube.Stay tuned.

You're my Best Friend by QueenI'll be there for you by The RembrandtsFriends by Led ZeppelinThe Way Old Friends Do by AbbaChiquitita by AbbaBen by Micheal JacksonI'll be there by Jackson 5Stand By Me by Ben E King

Ofcourse But i will be suggesting you the Greatest of Kota factory that i have got embedded in my mind and heart. You can start and end with this line DOSTI KOI REVISION THODI HAI JO KARNI HI HAI.  Pic credits: Screenshot from TVF YouTube Channel. Cheers to Friendship.

Yes…its my favorite friendship song.. Yaaro dosti badi he hasin hai ye na ho to…kya fir bolo ye zindgi hai…koi to ho Rajdar..begaraj tera ho yar..koi to ho rajdar. .. Apart this there are so many songs on friendship like.. Tere jesa yar kaha.,kaha aisa yarana..yad kregi duniya tera mera afsana.. from Yaarana And there is a very beautiful ad on friendship.. Chay ke liye jese toast hota hai vese her ek friend jaruri hota hai.. Airtel made some beautiful advertisement on friendship so you must watch it..

Friends forever. I don’t know who performed or sang that song but every time I listen to it, I would always think of them. The song was really meaningful and upbeat but when you listen to that song, indeed, there is always an end to every journey. Though, I am not friends with anyone and much more being best friends. Just acquainted.
Three good ones: We Are Going To Be Friends by Jack Johnson (2006):  Friends by Elton John (1971):  Old Friends by Simon and Garfunkel (1968):

There are so many songs in Bollywood for friendship. Like old song from yarana - Tere jaisa yaar kahan , kahan aisa yarana! Divya khosla Kumar's movie yaaeiyan - Apne roothr paraye roothe yaar roothe na. And the most popular and All time Favorite song from Sholay - Ye dosti Hm Nahi to denge.

My best friend is usually very upbeat and lively, but is also very sensitive and cares a lot what people think of her. There are a few songs that make me think of her. “Put Your Records On” by Corinne Bailey Rae “Klapp Klapp” by Little Dragon “Feel It Still” by Portugal. The Man
i love this song behti hawa sa tha woh from 3 idiots

There used to be a show on disney India named Ishaan. Pyari yaari dosti hai from Ishaan is a nice friendship song. The airtel ad song har ek friend zaroori hota hai is a good song. Yaari hai imaan from film Zanjeer, Ye Dosti from Sholay are the iconic friendship songs. These the few friendship songs I would like to suggest.

Apart from hindi and english songs, there are few songs in telugu. Dost mera dost from pelli pandiriMustaffa mustaffa from prema desamPadam etu pothunna from happy daysOh my friend from oh my friend…. :)
Mustaffa Mustaffa Song From Kadalan[Premadesham] best ever friendship song

The best friendship song ever sung, in my opinion, is Yaaron sung by KK. The sootheness n melody you get after listening to this song is inevitable. The voice and the rhythm plays a major role in this song. It reminds me of the enjoyment and fun we had done in our early days. Moreover, it also describes how a friend is an essential part in our life.
Some of the best Bollywood friendship songs are: Ye dosti hum nhi chhodenge…Atrangi yaari (Wazir)Tere Jaisa Yaar KahaanYaaron Dosti (Rockford/KK)Dil Chahta haiHappy listening :)
